results.title:
Kiki and Kitty
Kitty (Elaine Crombie) costume
results.material_description: polyester, sequins, turkey feathers, Haus of Dizzy gold mirror earrings
results.brief_description: In Kiki and Kitty (2017), Kitty (Elaine Crombie) is Kiki’s (Nakkiah Lui) fairy god-vagina, who shimmers in this sensual, sequined ensemble to embody all the repressed sass and sauciness of Lui’s buttoned-down lawyer.

results.title: Kika
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Esther Garcia, Agustin Almodovar and Ciby
results.brief_description: An intriguing web of desire, deceit and death are expertly woven together in this effervescent satire by the unrepentantly twisted director Pedro Almodovar. The madness begins with motormouth make-up artist Kika (Veronique Forque) being summoned to the home of ex-pat American writer Nicholas (Peter Coyote) to make over the corpse of his step-son, Ramon (Alex Casanovas). During her ministrations, Ramon awakens from a cataleptic trance, and the pair fall in love. Complicating their bizarre relationship further are Kika’s sporadic involvement with Nicholas, the lustful adoration of her maid, Juana (Rossy de Palma), and Ramon’s demented ex-girlfriend, Andrea Scarface (Victoria Abril), the host of the voyeuristic reality television show, `Today’s Worst’. Committed to turning private lives inside out for a scoop, Andrea zips around Madrid on a motorcycle with a camera strapped to her crash helmet. Things truly take a turn for the outrageous when Juana’s psychotic ex-porn star brother, Pablo, appears on the scene after breaking out of jail, with Andrea hot on his heels. An explicit but entertaining film filled with fabulous imagery and dazzling costumes from famous fashion designers Jean Paul Gaultier and Gianni Versace. Veronique Forque won a Goya Award for Best Lead Actress for her portrayal of Kika. In Spanish with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pedro Almodovar, Esther Garcia, Agustin Almodovar and Ciby

results.title: Kiewa catchment farm tree group: a community in action
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs. North Central Media Unit
results.brief_description: The Kiewa community formed a tree planting group to combat the problems of land degradation due to the impact of agricultural practices, the effect of tourisism in the area and erosion. This video shows how a small community in the alpine area of north-east Victoria, worked together to deal with an environmental problem.

results.title: Kiel Olympiad: Olympic yachting 1972
results.creator_credit: Laszlo Pal, Dick Enersen and Offshore Productions
results.brief_description: Captures the feel of the 1972 Olympic boat races by interweaving the thoughts of some of the sailors with a visual and aural narration of the racing action, the pageantry of the ceremonies, and the hard work and disappointments in racing. Held at Kiel, Germany, on the North Sea, six classes were raced: Dragon, Soling, Star, Tempest, Flying Dutchman and Finn Dinghy.

results.title: Kids, parents and pressures
results.creator_credit: Robert Sande, Robert Sande Productions and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Guidance for the 70’s”.
Teenagers attending a PACE Seminar identify some of the everyday pressures and tensions that confront them. With the help of highly qualified instructors, they learn they are in control of their own attitudes and work out positive and effective ways of improving their attitudes and relieving pressures.

results.title: Kids making decisions
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice, Victoria. Inner City School Support Centre and Corporate Relations Unit
results.brief_description: A program for primary teachers highlighting key features in developing integrated curriculum. An integrated curriculum goes beyond a thematic approach and involves coordinating all curriculum areas around one chosen topic to promote the development of learning. Shows teachers and their classes in three Western Metropolitan schools involved in choosing a topic, ordering concept areas and contributing questions. The pupils are involved by taking responsibility for their own learning in making key decisions.

results.title: Kids get cooking
results.brief_description: Everything you ever wanted to know about eggs. With puppets Herb and Bea, children Polly, Brad, Saba and Billy present “Eggs” - where they come and what you can do with them including learning recipes, experiments, crafts and more.

results.title: Kids do yoga too
results.creator_credit: Cathy Henkel, Nick Jeanes, Michael Murray, Wild Releasing, Lightsource Films and Naam Productions
results.brief_description: Introduce your children to the gentle art of yoga with this colourful and enjoyable video, filmed on the beach and in the Australian rainforest. With the use of poetry, playful illustrations and the help of seven children, yoga teacher Rachel Zinman demonstrates 18 Australian animal postures to show how easy and how much fun yoga can be. This exercise program is presented in two sections of approximately 15 minutes each, so that it can be broken into smaller parts for practice in the home. It is designed for children aged 5-12 and parents should take care to adhere to the cautionary warnings at the beginning of the tape.
